title: Italian Turkey Meatballs Recipe
description: Italian-style turkey meatballs are lean and clean with fresh herbs, Parmesan cheese, and seasoned bread crumbs. Try them on pasta or in a meatball sub!
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Everyday Cooking Italian Turkey Meatballs 4.7 (343) 240 Reviews 64 Photos These Italian-style turkey meatballs are made with lean ground turkey, fresh herbs, Parmesan cheese, and seasoned bread crumbs. Serve with pasta and sauce, or in a sandwich. Submitted by Melt Organic Buttery Spread Updated on December 30, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 64 64 64 64 Prep Time: 30 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 45 mins Servings: 6 Yield: 30 meatballs Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 2 teaspoons Melt® Organic Buttery Spread, softened 1 ½ pounds ground lean turkey ⅔ cup dry Italian bread crumbs ⅓ cup chopped fresh parsley ¼ cup shredded Parmesan cheese ¼ cup tomato sauce 3 cloves garlic, minced 3 tablespoons chopped fresh oregano 2 teaspoons chopped fresh rosemary 1 teaspoon dry mustard ½ teaspoon cayenne pepper ¼ teaspoon salt Directions Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Grease a broiler pan with buttery spread. Mix ground turkey, bread crumbs, parsley, Parmesan, tomato sauce, garlic, oregano, rosemary, mustard, cayenne, and salt together in a large bowl until well combined. Form mixture into 30 meatballs; place onto the prepared pan. Bake in the preheated oven until no longer pink inside, about 15 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). I Made It Print 823 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 253 Calories 12g Fat 11g Carbs 23g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 6 Calories 253 % Daily Value * Total Fat 12g 16% Saturated Fat 4g 18% Cholesterol 93mg 31% Sodium 495mg 22% Total Carbohydrate 11g 4% Dietary Fiber 1g 3% Protein 23g 47% Vitamin C 7mg 8% Calcium 89mg 7% Iron 3mg 14% Potassium 341mg 7% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Italian Turkey Meatballs 01 of 64 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 64 Photo by  Sylvia Roy McCormick 02/26/2022 These are excellent! These are my substitutions and comments: I made mine with a pound and a half ground chicken. Before putting them in the oven, I rolled my meatballs around in about 2 teaspoons garlic infused olive oil that I had placed in the bottom of my stoneware. That gave them a nice glisten. They cooked well in my stoneware at 400° for 20 minutes. 03 of 64 Photo by  Raybuh 07/06/2021 04 of 64 Photo by  MrsDeki 02/14/2021 05 of 64 Photo by  Marmast 02/12/2021 06 of 64 Photo by  Rita Piemonte-Goodhue 12/09/2020 This recipe was so easy ! I’m Italian and these were banging I used dry spices , added some onion powder and fresh grated cheese . Used Pam spray instead of the suggested butter . Definitely a keeper and when I make my sauce I’ll drop some in and nobody will know , even though my family eats pretty much everything!! 07 of 64 Photo by  pattio56 11/09/2020 08 of 64 Photo by  Ana Redquill 05/14/2020 09 of 64 Photo by  Krjones74 04/16/2020 10 of 64 Photo by  parlance 03/31/2020 Turned out really nice! I modified for a 1 pound package and substituted dry spices as that's all I have right now. But very happy with how it turned out. In the future, I would use as much tomato sauce as the original recipe, as I think my modification made them a bit dry. Very yummy! 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Healthier Italian Spaghetti Sauce with Meatballs 12 Ratings Pizza Turkey Burgers with Quick Marinara 1 Rating Mozzarella-Stuffed Pesto Turkey Meatballs 387 Ratings Eggplant Meatballs 42 Ratings Layered Eggplant Hamburger Casserole 114 Ratings Homemade Italian Sausage Patties 3 Ratings American Lasagna 2,736 Ratings No-Cream Pasta Primavera 604 Ratings Mexican-Style Spaghetti and Meatballs 24 Ratings Pesto Turkey Meatballs 9 Ratings Italian Rib Eye 75 Ratings Bracciole (Flank Steak Rolls) 22 Ratings Slow Cooker Turkey Meatballs in Tomato Sauce 12 Ratings Italian Turkey Zoodles 35 Ratings Sweet and Sour Meatballs in Sauce 35 Ratings Slow Cooker Turkey Sausage Meatballs 1 Rating Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Melt Organic Buttery Spread
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Grease a broiler pan with buttery spread.;Mix ground turkey, bread crumbs, parsley, Parmesan, tomato sauce, garlic, oregano, rosemary, mustard, cayenne, and salt together in a large bowl until well combined. Form mixture into 30 meatballs; place onto the prepared pan.;Bake in the preheated oven until no longer pink inside, about 15 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
